I'm a certified addictions counselor and familiar with most agencies. If your low income-no insurance you should call Arapahoe House. They're by far the largest sub agency in CO and have low income services. They have a 45-day inpatient program, but I don't  believe its free.  Salvation Army has a pretty good inpatient program, with good aftercare, but typically has a long waiting list. The key parts is has she applied or been approved for medicaid? Does she have SSI? Is she a vet? Do you know if she also has a MH diagnosis? Mental Health Center of Denver has a few inpatient dual diagnosis options if she[.] already setup with them. There[.] options, but if she[.] a homeless, no med coverage, and against going-you need all the luck cause there[.] very limited services. You can always take. him to detox at Denver Cares or Arapahoe House, and then review his needs then.

People on probation or parole you have a few options, otherwise I hope you have high income. CeDar is one of the major programs, but very expensive. Also there is the ARTS program that is ran by CU-Denver but I don't think they do inpatient, but offer intensive outpatient and RX assistance (suboxone, methadone, Vivitrol). I think if she did Intensive Outpatient, along with possibly Vivitrol, that'd be huge. Then review any possible psych needs when she is sober. Sorry.... on mobile. 

Edit: my post applies better for gen info, i must've misread OPs post because some of this doesn't apply. PM me and I'll help a. lot more on a comp. Hate typing on mobile
